summary: This is a July 2, 2020 press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury related to 2016 depositions. The document details the alleged grooming and abuse scheme spanning from 1994 to 1997 across multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, facilitating the grooming and abuse of victims as young as 14, and committing perjury in 2016 depositions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have sexually abused minor girls with the assistance of Ghislaine Maxwell from at least 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged role in the abuse scheme.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Made a statement praising the victims' bravery and condemning Maxwell and Epstein's actions.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement condemning the alleged crimes and commending investigators.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom the case against Ghislaine Maxwell is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, and in some cases participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14, involving grooming, transportation, and abuse at multiple residences.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly made several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and a federal indictment was unsealed charging her with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors and perjury.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors from at least 1994 to 1997.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a critical role in grooming victims as young as 14 by befriending them, taking them on trips, and normalizing sexual interactions with Epstein.
Abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as at Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell is also charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath during 2016 depositions.
The press release includes statements from top law enforcement officials praising the victims' bravery and condemning the alleged crimes.
